com.oceanoptics.omnidriver.features.externaltriggerdelay

Interface ExternalTriggerDelay


  • public interface ExternalTriggerDelay
    This interface represents devices that provide a delay between an external trigger and starting acquisition.

    The intended devices are the HR2000+, HR4000, QE65000, USB2000+, HR2000+, and USB4000.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Integer getExternalTriggerDelay()
      Get the current trigger delay.
      int getExternalTriggerDelayIncrement()
      Gets the allowed count step size for external trigger delays.
      int getExternalTriggerDelayMaximum()
      Gets the largest allowed number of counts that the device supports.
      int getExternalTriggerDelayMinimum()
      Gets the smallest allowed number of counts that the device supports.
      void setExternalTriggerDelay(int counts)
      Command the device to use a new trigger delay, specified in microseconds.
      double triggerDelayCountsToMicroseconds(int counts)
      Convert from the number of counts to the actual delay in microseconds.

    • Method Detail

      • setExternalTriggerDelay

        void setExternalTriggerDelay(int counts)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Command the device to use a new trigger delay, specified in microseconds.
        Parameters:
        counts - Number of counts to delay external trigger.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is thrown if the device cannot issue the delay command.

      • getExternalTriggerDelay

        java.lang.Integer getExternalTriggerDelay()
        Get the current trigger delay. This value may be cached, and not actually read from the device on every call.
        Returns:
        Current number of counts of external trigger delay.

      • triggerDelayCountsToMicroseconds

        double triggerDelayCountsToMicroseconds(int counts)
        Convert from the number of counts to the actual delay in microseconds.
        Parameters:
        counts - Number of counts to represent as microseconds.
        Returns:
        the delay, in microseconds, corresponding to given counts.

      • getExternalTriggerDelayMinimum

        int getExternalTriggerDelayMinimum()
        Gets the smallest allowed number of counts that the device supports.
        Returns:
        the minimum number of counts allowed.

      • getExternalTriggerDelayMaximum

        int getExternalTriggerDelayMaximum()
        Gets the largest allowed number of counts that the device supports.
        Returns:
        maximum number of counts allowed.

      • getExternalTriggerDelayIncrement

        int getExternalTriggerDelayIncrement()
        Gets the allowed count step size for external trigger delays. This is intended for SpinnerNumberModel support.
        Returns:
        Increment size for delay counts.
